author: Staff Reporter
text:
With private buses set to be off Bengaluru roads during the upcoming Invest Karnataka 2016 meet, the Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) will ply additional buses between Monday and Friday to meet the anticipated rush.

Squads

However, there will not be any changes to the existing KSRTC bus routes, a release said. Meanwhile, the Transport Department has formed 25 squads to ensure enforcement of the ban on movement of private buses, tourist minivans and goods vehicles (of all categories) between 7 a.m. and 10 p.m. on all five days.

The squads — which also include police and BMTC officials — will be stationed on Tumakuru Road (exhibition ground), Mysuru Road (Nice Road Junction), Hosur Road (Attibele), Kanakapura Road (Nice Road Junction), K.R. Puram (Toll Plaza) and Hebbal Road (Bagalur Cross).

Apart from these, 19 mobile squads have been formed to monitor the movement of vehicles, the release said.
